topics.body:
"@Bryon":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5453e8a7636872796ae40200#post_5453e8a7636872796ae40200
They're only traveling to the future. And then they fight their way to a checkpoint before they can go back to the present. It's like a sick game.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5453e8fe6368727e6a430000#post_5453e8fe6368727e6a430000
I remember that aspect from when Shonen Jump had physical copies in the States. In some ways, trying to figure it out, I was eventually like "That's it! I'm done!"
topics.author: 5056c9e87f123b37f6012a34

topics.body:
"@Bryon":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5453ea2d6368726777e40200#post_5453ea2d6368726777e40200
So we have time traveling phone cards, a Fallout style future, a twisted game, evil bug monsters, and now there's psychic powers.
A good setup for a shonen battle manga/mystery manga.

"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5454063463687275d64b0000#post_5454063463687275d64b0000
Well no. At the end of day they are just software. But therein lies the beauty of them. They can sing about anything and it never feel out of place.
Hatsune Miku is at once no ones voice, yet she is everyone's voice.
